alert.note: Alert for Oglethorpe; Wilkes (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 3:46PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Hancock, eastern Greene, western Taliaferro, western Wilkes and eastern Oglethorpe Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 346 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Stephens to near Siloam to near Shoulderbone, and moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Crawfordville, Union Point, Woodville, White Plains, Siloam, Rayle, Robinson, Lyneville, Philomath, Alexander Stephens Park, Carters Grove and Daniel Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
